definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]

sentences.english: Carrie had gone sobbing from the door to the window. She was so overcome she could not speak.
sentences.chinese: 嘉莉抽抽搭搭地从门边走到窗前，哭得说不出话来了。

sentences.english: We can hear the child sobbing in the other room.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到那间屋子里的小孩在抽抽搭搭地哭著。

sentences.english: The child's sobs gradually died down.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子的抽搭声渐渐消失了。

sentences.english: We could hear the child sobbing in the other room.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到那间屋子里的小孩在抽抽搭搭地哭着。
“请不要丢下我不管，”他抽抽搭搭地说。

definition: to cry out loud without tears
to mumble in whispers/to mutter to oneself
to murmur/to speak in a low voice
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
(onom.) patter, splatter, click/to smack one's lips/to pull (on a pipe)
